title: SigV4 Request Handler for AWS
description: Streamline AWS integration in Unreal Engine with SigV4 authentication
longDescription:
AWS SigV4 Request Handler is a powerful and flexible plugin for Unreal Engine that enables seamless integration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) by providing SigV4 authentication for HTTP requests. With this plugin, you can easily interact with various AWS services, such as Amazon S3, DynamoDB, AWS Lambda, and more, directly from your Unreal Engine projects while ensuring the security and integrity of your AWS requests.


Use Cases:

  • Real-time Multiplayer Games: Easily manage assets and data in Amazon S3, run serverless functions with AWS Lambda, or store game state in DynamoDB.
  • Virtual Reality Experiences: Utilize AWS services to store and retrieve VR assets, manage user data, and scale server resources as needed.
  • Architectural Visualization: Integrate AWS services to handle large datasets and deliver real-time visualizations of complex architectural models.
  • Simulation and Training: Manage training data and simulations with AWS services for enhanced realism and scalability.

Features:

  • AWS SigV4 Authentication: Automate AWS SigV4 request signing for secure AWS service requests, eliminating manual authentication.
  • Versatile AWS Service Support: Compatible with various AWS services, enabling cloud storage, serverless computing, and database management within Unreal Engine projects.
  • Easy Integration: Seamlessly integrate into Unreal Engine projects with minimal setup, saving time and effort.
  • Customizable Request Handling: Tailor the plugin to your needs by adding custom headers, managing responses, and implementing advanced features.
  • Error Handling: Robust error management ensures graceful handling of errors and exceptions during AWS service interactions.

Plugin Documentation:

  • Plugin Documentation: A comprehensive guide to set up and utilize the Unreal AWS SigV4 Request Handler plugin effectively.

AWS Signer v4 Documentation:

  • Amazon's Signer v4 Documentation: Reference documentation from Amazon Web Services detailing the AWS Signature Version 4 (SigV4) authentication process for further understanding.


Discord Channel
technicalDetails:
Technical Features:

  • Event Triggering: Trigger events after receiving responses from AWS services, offering post-processing control.
  • HTTP Request Methods: Supports multiple HTTP request methods (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, CONNECT, OPTIONS) for flexible AWS service communication.
  • Blueprint Exposed Headers: User-friendly Blueprint interface for defining custom headers in requests.
  • Blueprint Exposed Signature Creation: Easily create AWS SigV4 signatures using Blueprint nodes for simplified authentication.
  • Blueprint Exposed Signed Request Sending: Send authenticated requests directly from Blueprints, reducing development complexity.
  • Cryptographic Algorithms: Implements SHA-256 and HMAC-SHA-256 cryptographic algorithms natively in Unreal Engine's C++ code for secure data handling.
  • Data Types: Flexible support for TArray<uint8> or FString data types when using SHA-256 and HMAC-SHA-256 algorithms in C++.
  • Code Modules:
  • AwsSigner (Runtime): The core module responsible for AWS SigV4 request signing and communication.
  • Blueprints:
  • Number of Blueprints: 1
  • C++ Classes:
  • Number of C++ Classes: 3

Supported Development Platforms: Win64, Mac, Linux

Supported Target Build Platforms: Win64, Mac, Android, iOS, Linux
